questions.questionText: What are the Australian values that you must accept and uphold if you want to become an Australian citizen?
options: Respect for the freedom and dignity of the individual
Respect for the rule of law
Parliamentary democracy
Equality of men and women
All of the above
questions.explanation: Accepting and upholding all the mentioned values is necessary to become an Australian citizen.

questions.questionText: What is the significance of the Australian flag?
options: Represents the unity of the Australian people
Symbolizes Australia's British heritage
Represents the unique natural environment of Australia
All of the above
questions.explanation: The Australian flag holds all the mentioned significance and represents multiple aspects of Australia.

questions.questionText: What is the significance of the Australian Coat of Arms?
options: Represents Australia's history and identity
Includes symbols of native Australian animals
Symbolizes the sovereignty of Australia
All of the above
questions.explanation: The Australian Coat of Arms represents all the mentioned aspects, making it significant to Australia.

questions.questionText: What is the significance of the national anthem 'Advance Australia Fair'?
options: Celebrates Australian spirit of freedom, democracy, and equality
Represents the country's shared values, history, and culture
Calls on all Australians to stand together as a proud and united nation
All of the above
questions.explanation: The national anthem 'Advance Australia Fair' embodies all the mentioned significance, promoting unity and pride.

questions.questionText: What are the Australian values of freedom and democracy?
options: Reflected in the system of government based on parliamentary democracy
Ensured by the rule of law and the Australian Constitution
Protecting the rights and freedoms of all Australians
All of the above
questions.explanation: The values of freedom and democracy encompass all the mentioned aspects, shaping the Australian society.
